isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE REDUCTION AXLES WITH CONTROLLED TRACTION DIFFERENTIALS: EATON - CTD EFFECTIVENESS CHECK

svcproc.title: CTD EFFECTIVENESS CHECK
svcproc.para: Checking the effectiveness of the controlled traction differentials determines the friction plate condition.

The bias torque of a new unit will check out at approximately 4,000 ft-lbs. (or higher) for Heavy-duty CTD, and 3,000 ft-Ibs. (or higher) for Medium-duty CTD. If bias torque value drops to 1,500 ft-Ibs. (or less), replace the clutch pack.
Check bias torque values as follows:

step1.para: Disconnect drive shaft at the drive pinion.
Block one wheel or otherwise restrain vehicle.
Jack up the other wheel free of the ground.
Using a torque wrench, rotate the pinion and note torque reading.
Formula: Torque times axle ratio equals bias differential torque.

warning.para: Use jack stands as additional support of the vehicle to prevent personal injury or death.
